Abs.documentation: Calculates the absolute value of a number.
Abs.label: Function Abs(expr as Integer) as Integer

params.label: expr
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

Asc.documentation: Returns the unicode code of a character.
Asc.label: Function Asc (char as String) as Integer

params.label: char
params.documentation: The character to get the code for. If a string is used, the code for the first character is given.

Atn.label: Function Atn(expression)
Atn.documentation: Calculates the arctangent of a number.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

Call.label: Call ( "function" [, paramN] )
Call.documentation: Calls a user-defined or built-in function contained in first parameter.

params.label: function
params.documentation: The name of function or function to call.

params.label: paramN
params.documentation: Argument(s) that will be passed to the function being invoked.

Chr.label: Function Chr ( ASCIIcode )
Chr.documentation: Returns a character corresponding to an ASCII code.

params.label: ASCIIcode
params.documentation: An ASCII code in the range 0-255 (e.g., 65 returns the capital letter A).

Cos.label: Function Cos ( expression )
Cos.documentation: Calculates the cosine of a number.

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Value in radians.

Exp.documentation: Calculates e to the power of a number.
Exp.label: Function Exp ( expression )

params.label: expression
params.documentation: Any valid numeric expression.

Hex.documentation: Returns a string representation of an integer or of a binary type converted to hexadecimal.
Hex.label: Function Hex ( expression [, length] )

params.label: expression
params.documentation: The expression to convert.

params.label: length
params.documentation:
**[optional]** Number of characters to be returned for integer.  
Characters are truncated from the left-hand side if length is too small.  
This parameter is ignored if the data is binary data.

InputBox.documentation: Displays an input box to ask the user to enter a string.
InputBox.label: Function InputBox ( "title", "prompt" [, "default" [, "password char" [, width = -1 [, height = -1 [, left = Default [, top = Default [, timeout = 0 [, hwnd]]]]]]]] )

params.label: title
params.documentation: The title of the input box.

params.label: prompt
params.documentation: A message to the user indicating what kind of input is expected.

params.label: default
params.documentation: **[optional]** The value that the input box starts with.

params.label: password char
params.documentation: **[optional]** The character to replace all typed characters with in the display. If you want the actual typed character to appear, define with an empty string ("") (default) or a space for the first character. If you provide a multi-character string, only the first character is used for character masking. There are special meanings for the second and subsequent characters.

params.label: width
params.documentation: **[optional]** The width of the window.

params.label: height
params.documentation: **[optional]** The height of the window.

params.label: left
params.documentation: **[optional]** The left side of the input box. By default, the box is centered.

params.label: top
params.documentation: **[optional]** The top of the input box. By default, the box is centered.

params.label: timeout
params.documentation: **[optional]** How many seconds to wait before automatically canceling the InputBox().

params.label: hwnd
params.documentation: **[optional]** The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

Int.documentation: Returns the integer (whole number) representation of an expression.
Int.label: Function Int ( expression [, flag = 0] ) as Integer

params.label: expression
params.documentation: An expression to convert into an integer.

params.label: flag
params.documentation:
**[optional]** Defines behavior.  
Can be one of the following:  
 `$NUMBER_AUTO` (`0`) = (default) the result is auto-sized integer.  
 `$NUMBER_32BIT` (`1`) = string is interpreted as a 32bit integer  
 `$NUMBER_64BIT` (`2`) = string is interpreted as a 64bit integer.  

Constants are defined in "AutoItConstants.au3".
